subject: Programming
title: Fixation and Functional Fixedness
description: Learn Fixation and Functional Fixedness in one minute.

hook.text: You keep trying the same approach even though it fails. Your brain is stuck in a rut.

buildup.text: Functional fixedness means seeing tools and solutions only in their conventional use.

discovery.text: A programmer stuck on sorting may not consider that the data doesn't need to be sorted at all.

twist.text: The best breakthroughs come from reframing the problem entirely, not from optimizing the current approach.

climax.text: When stuck, ask 'what if the opposite were true?' Inversion breaks mental fixation.

punchline.text: If you're stuck, change the question, not the answer.

quiz.question: What is functional fixedness?
options: Seeing tools only in their conventional use
